newsitem.title: USA: Buddhist temple repaid some DNC donations - paper.
newsitem.headline: Buddhist temple repaid some DNC donations - paper.

text.p: The Buddhist temple that hosted a controversial political fundraiser last year that featured Vice President Al Gore, has privately reimbursed some of the donations made to the Democratic campaign, the Los Angeles Times reported on Friday.
The undeclared repayments, ranging from $2,200 to 5,000, came from about a dozen contributors, the paper said.
Federal election law prohibits reimbursements of campaign contributions and requires disclosure of the true source of any funds.

The paper said newly obtained documents also reveal that the Hsi Lai Temple engaged in a range of other political activities that raise questions about the religious center's compliance with tax laws that ban partisan activities by nonprofit institutions.

The report said records show the nearly 10-year-old temple had hosted a 1990 fund-raiser for a Connecticut gubernatorial candidate, provided support for various politicians and had lobbied Congress on immigration issues.
An attorney for the temple declined to answer questions about the temple's fund-raising, the Times said.
